verses.text: \sc The\sc* word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch;
Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for the \sc Lord\sc* hath added grief to my sorrow; I fainted in my sighing, and I find no rest.

Thus shalt thou say unto him, The \sc Lord\sc* saith thus; Behold, \add that\add* which I have built \add will\add* I break down, and \add that\add* which I have planted I \add will\add* pluck up, even this whole land.

And seekest thou great \add things\add* for thyself? seek \add them\add* not: for behold, I \add will\add* bring evil upon all flesh, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.
